metadata.title: Ovarian Cancer with Peritoneal Spread (TCGA-09-0364)
metadata.description: Rubric for CT interpretation of ovarian cancer with peritoneal spread, based on TCGA-09-0364.
metadata.author: Michael Okafor, MD

categories.name: Ovarian Cancer Assessment
categories.description: Key elements for CT interpretation of ovarian cancer with peritoneal spread.

criteria.name: Description of Adnexal Masses
criteria.description: Describes bilateral adnexal masses: architecture (solid/cystic), margins, calcifications, septations.
criteria.rationale: Characterization of adnexal masses is critical for staging and guiding further workup.

scoring_guide.0: No mention of adnexal masses or critical features (architecture, laterality)
scoring_guide.1: Mentions mass(es) but omits key descriptors (e.g., cystic vs. solid, laterality)
scoring_guide.2: Fully describes both masses including architecture, septations, calcifications, and laterality

criteria.name: Peritoneal Disease Identification
criteria.description: Mentions presence and location of peritoneal implants in spleen LUQ and paracolic gutters.
criteria.rationale: Precise documentation of spread impacts FIGO staging and prognosis.

scoring_guide.1: Mentions general peritoneal spread but not specific locations
scoring_guide.2: Accurately describes peritoneal implants in spleen LUQ and paracolic gutters

criteria.name: Ascites Assessment
criteria.description: Identifies presence of ascites and comments on diagnostic relevance.
criteria.rationale: Ascites is a key feature of advanced disease and should be described.

scoring_guide.1: Mentions ascites without characterizing volume or significance
scoring_guide.2: Correctly identifies trace/small ascites and notes clinical implication

criteria.name: Differential Diagnosis
criteria.description: Provides a prioritized differential including epithelial ovarian carcinoma and others.
criteria.rationale: A focused differential guides early management and biopsy strategy.

scoring_guide.1: General or broad differential without prioritization
scoring_guide.2: Includes epithelial ovarian carcinoma and considers other cystic/solid neoplasms

criteria.name: FIGO Staging Estimate
criteria.description: Estimates likely FIGO stage and supports with findings.
criteria.rationale: Staging impacts treatment planning and surgical candidacy.

scoring_guide.2: Estimates FIGO stage III or higher based on peritoneal spread and ascites

criteria.name: Management / Follow-Up
criteria.description: Suggests logical next steps based on findings.
criteria.rationale: Linking imaging findings to clinical steps reflects applied diagnostic reasoning.

scoring_guide.2: Suggests CA-125, biopsy, gynecologic oncology referral
